info.name: Partio
info.description:
Complete API collection for Partio â€” a multi-tenant RESTful platform for semantic cell chunking and embedding.

Variables:
- `baseUrl`: Server base URL (default: http://localhost:8400)
- `bearerToken`: Admin API key or credential bearer token
- `tenantId`: Target tenant ID
- `userId`: Target user ID
- `credentialId`: Target credential ID
- `endpointId`: Target embedding endpoint ID
- `requestId`: Target request history entry ID
- `embeddingModel`: Embedding model name (default: all-minilm)
- `chunkStrategy`: Chunking strategy (default: FixedTokenCount)
- `fixedTokenCount`: Token count per chunk (default: 256)
- `maxResults`: Enumeration page size (default: 100)
- `continuationToken`: Pagination continuation token

item.name: Health
item.description: Health check endpoints. No authentication required.

request.description: Simple health check. Returns 200 OK with no body.
Returns health status and version.
Returns health status JSON with version information.

item.name: Process (Chunk & Embed)
item.description: Core chunking and embedding endpoints. Requires bearer token authentication.

exec: pm.test('Response has Text and Chunks', function () {

request.description: Process a single semantic cell. Chunks the input text and computes embeddings using the specified endpoint.
Process text using sentence-based chunking strategy.
Process text using paragraph-based chunking strategy.
Process an unordered list as a single chunk using WholeList strategy.
Process an ordered list where each item becomes its own chunk.
Process a table using RowWithHeaders strategy. Each data row becomes its own chunk with markdown table headers prepended.
Process a table using Row strategy. Each data row becomes a chunk of space-separated values (no headers).
Process a table using RowGroupWithHeaders strategy. Data rows are grouped into batches of RowGroupSize with headers prepended to each group.
Process a table using KeyValuePairs strategy. Each data row becomes 'key1: val1, key2: val2, ...'.
Process a table using WholeTable strategy. The entire table is serialized as a single markdown table chunk.
Process a code snippet. Uses the Text field with Type set to Code for code-aware chunking.
Process a hyperlink atom. Uses the Text field with Type set to Hyperlink.
Process a metadata atom. Uses the Text field with Type set to Meta for metadata content.
Process text with L2 normalization enabled on embeddings.

exec: pm.test('Response is an array with Text', function () {

request.description: Process multiple semantic cells in a single request.

item.name: Tenants
item.description: Tenant management endpoints. Requires admin authentication.

request.description: Create a new tenant. Also auto-creates a default user, credential, and embedding endpoints. The response tenant ID is automatically saved to the `tenantId` variable.
Read a tenant by ID.
Update an existing tenant.
Check if a tenant exists. Returns 200 if found, 404 if not.

body.raw:
{
    "MaxResults": {{maxResults}},
    "ContinuationToken": null,
    "Order": "CreatedDescending",
    "NameFilter": null,
    "LabelFilter": null,
    "TagKeyFilter": null,
    "TagValueFilter": null,
    "ActiveFilter": null
}

request.description: List tenants with pagination and filtering. Use ContinuationToken from the response for the next page.
Fetch the next page of tenants using the continuation token.
Delete a tenant. Cascade deletes associated users, credentials, and endpoints.

item.name: Users
item.description: User management endpoints. Requires admin authentication.

request.description: Create a new user. The response user ID is automatically saved to the `userId` variable.
Read a user by ID. Password is always redacted in the response.
Update an existing user.
Check if a user exists. Returns 200 if found, 404 if not.
List users with pagination and filtering.
Delete a user.

item.name: Credentials
item.description: Credential/bearer token management endpoints. Requires admin authentication.

request.description: Create a new credential. A bearer token is auto-generated. The response credential ID is automatically saved to the `credentialId` variable.
Read a credential by ID. Includes the bearer token.
Update an existing credential.
Check if a credential exists. Returns 200 if found, 404 if not.
List credentials with pagination and filtering.
Delete a credential.

item.name: Embedding Endpoints
item.description: Embedding endpoint configuration management. Requires admin authentication.

request.description: Create a new embedding endpoint. The response endpoint ID is automatically saved to the `endpointId` variable.
Read an embedding endpoint by ID.
Update an existing embedding endpoint.
Check if an embedding endpoint exists. Returns 200 if found, 404 if not.
List embedding endpoints with pagination and filtering.
Get the health status for a specific monitored endpoint. Returns 404 if health checking is not enabled for this endpoint.
Get health status for all monitored endpoints. Non-admin callers see only their tenant's endpoints.
Delete an embedding endpoint.

item.name: Request History
item.description: Request history viewing and management. Requires admin authentication.

request.description: Read a request history entry by ID.
Read the full request/response body detail from filesystem storage.
List request history entries with pagination. The first result's ID is automatically saved to the `requestId` variable.
Delete a request history entry.

item.name: Error Cases
item.description: Requests expected to return error responses, useful for testing error handling.

request.description: Request without authentication. Expected: 401 Unauthorized.
Request with an invalid bearer token. Expected: 401 Unauthorized.
Request for a resource that does not exist. Expected: 404 Not Found.

exec: pm.test('Error message mentions strategy compatibility', function () {

request.description: Demonstrates 400 error when using a table-only strategy (Row) on a Text atom type. Set {{endpointId}} to a valid endpoint ID first.
Demonstrates 400 error when using a table-only strategy (RowWithHeaders) on a List atom type. Set {{endpointId}} to a valid endpoint ID first.
Demonstrates 400 error when using a list-only strategy (WholeList) on a Table atom type. Set {{endpointId}} to a valid endpoint ID first.
Process request with empty body. Expected: 400 Bad Request. Set {{endpointId}} to a valid endpoint ID first.
